text:
Heres a worker I use to do something like  that <@U06DURYFXK7>
<https://gitlab.com/-/snippets/3675960>

I use it to It to filter markets by competitions. I schedule it to run every hour, It fetches the Betfair navigation calls “process_navigation” on any strategy where the method is defined. Each strategy can decide what it needs from nav, and if it doesn’t need nav I just don’t define the process_nav function.

elements.text: Heres a worker I use to do something like  that

I use it to It to filter markets by competitions. I schedule it to run every hour, It fetches the Betfair navigation calls “process_navigation” on any strategy where the method is defined. Each strategy can decide what it needs from nav, and if it doesn’t need nav I just don’t define the process_nav function.

text: Hi All I am new to this chat so looking forward to exploring the content. My background is in Machine Learning modelling for sports. I have also written a series of blog posts on accessing the Betfair API. For those of you interested in no code required sports betting modelling I have created a GUI based approach to ML modelling sports data called MySportsAI. My blog is <https://markatsmartersig.wordpress.com/>

text: <@U06KP54CEMR> I think years and years ago I based my first python based bot on something you published, back in the days of polling. Does that sound right? That was my first contact with python and the first time I stepped away from using third party software. It was super simple, just a big loop of a handful of functions and nothing else. If that is right I think maybe <@U4H19D1D2> based his early efforts on the same thing. If I've got this right then I've a lot to thank you for.

text: Bloody hell, Fred77 is a blast from the past! We were in regular contact many years ago via a forum called DIYbetfairbots or something similar. We shared a fair bit of knowledge on our web scraping libraries which circumvented the 1 request per second "free API6". His was in PHP, mine was VB6 and then I started using python due to adoption of VPS. God, I feel old now. :grinning:

elements.text: Bloody hell, Fred77 is a blast from the past! We were in regular contact many years ago via a forum called DIYbetfairbots or something similar. We shared a fair bit of knowledge on our web scraping libraries which circumvented the 1 request per second "free API6". His was in PHP, mine was VB6 and then I started using python due to adoption of VPS. God, I feel old now.

text: I remember him closing down his forum. Can't remember exactly when that was but pretty sure it was mid 2000's sometime. He was a good egg as I recall. Are you still in touch and if so is he still at it?

text:
<@U01DPK9PGMC> the smartersig tutorial you posted looks very familiar, but was written quite a few years after I started sharing my version on <http://bespokebots.com|bespokebots.com>. It may have been based on mine, maybe not. The boilerplate code is pretty much the same for every polling library I've seen over the years.
<@UUE6E1LA1> I've not heard from Fred for a good 10 years or more. He was very much like myself...was making decent money but not life changing amounts. Last time we spoke, I recall he was finding the game a lot harder than it had been previously, so I've no idea whether he continued or gave up...
